They are counting on division and subtraction. We need to focus on addition and multiplication. It’s simple math.

In our democracy, every vote counts. This November, it’s time to reclaim what it means to be American, what it means to be a patriot. Our democracy is counting on each and everyone of you. 60 days. Call, register, email, knock, text, tweet. But most especially, vote.

True patriotism is NOT rooted in false salutations but in holding our gov't accountable to represent us all.When it fails, we as patriots are compelled to speak. Here in Philly,our founding fathers birthed a new nation born out of grievance & protest.  #TheArena

Our diversity is our greatest strength, not a weakness. We have a wonderful future together, but not much of one on our own.  This notion is central to our American aspiration.  It is about who we are. In Philly this weekend, we must aspire to fulfill that more perfect union.

In this moment, the very idea of America is on the line.  There is actually no better time in our nation’s history to confront the truth about race as a means to bringing people together. We can tackle our toughest challenges only when we face them. #truth #TheArena

For generations, our diversity and multiculturalism have been seen as one of this nation’s great strengths.  “E pluribus unum.”   "All men are created equal." "Liberty and justice for all", not some. If they love freedom, justice and liberty, they are our neighbor. #TheArena

We are in a dark moment right now. Getting out of it is not going to happen on accident. It isn't normal.  We cannot sit idly by. We have to unite around a common purpose- around community, around responsibility, around hard work. #TheArena

Our founders knew that "a more perfect union" was an aspiration, to make us better. That is what we are about. This country was founded on an idea that we all come to the table of democracy as equals. It's up to us to keep reaching forward, to keep pushing. #TheArena

RT @usmayors: Immediate Past President Mitch Landrieu delivers remarks to open our luncheon. #USCM2018 https://t.co/3fvdmzysuM

Mayors, I implore you to continue to use your voice for good, to speak out for those amongst us whose voices are not heard, and to continue to work together to shape a brighter future for us all. #uscm2018

I am confident Mayors Benjamin and Barnett will continue the strong tradition of leaders who came before them at this conference who stood for civil rights, economic justice, public safety, and equity. @stevebenjaminsc @mayorbarnett @usmayors #uscm2018

Throughout the past year, it’s become more evident that mayors must heed the call to unite our country. After 30 years in public office I am confident that your ideas and courage will shape our future, strengthen our democracy, and move this nation forward. #uscm2018

At this challenging time, when our govt. is pushing us backward, the truth is disposable and deceit is used as a weapon, & the echoes of past injustices linger just beneath the surface, we need courage not just from politicians but from ordinary Americans. #uscm2018

We must reaffirm our commitment to a future where each citizen is guaranteed the uniquely American gifts of life, liberty & the pursuit of happiness—what really makes America great. Out of many we are one. We are 1 nation, not 2. Indivisible w/ liberty & justice for all, not some

There is no need in our great country to feel afraid or threatened by those who look different. Anyone who seeks freedom, justice & liberty should be welcomed as our neighbor. Americans do no need to push each other away to claim their fair share of the American dream. #uscm2018

The future does not belong to those who ignore working class men and women in the heartland who feel left behind by an economy that rewards only a few. The future can never belong to those who seek to divide us for their personal profit or political success. #uscm2018

The future does not belong to a place that denies anybody the right to be free from discrimination because of who they choose to love, to a country who closes itself off to young African-American boys and girls who still feel left out of the mainstream. #uscm2018

We know the future doesn't belong to a place that closes its doors to those who seek freedom or closes its heart to Hispanic families trying to build better lives for their children or to our Muslim neighbors seeking the same religious liberty that lets us choose our faith.

The greatness of our democracy is that between the extremes, we find common ground where Americans come together to celebrate each other and work hand in hand to create a better future for our families and for generations yet to come. #uscm2018

Here is what I learned in my years in public service: we are all the same. We all want the same chance to provide for our families and the same things for our children – safety, opportunity and freedom. #uscm2018

During these uncertain times in our country, we feel despair of those who feel left behind, parents who fear for their child’s safety. We understand the frustration fueled by dysfunction in Washington that is causing division in our communities. #uscm2018

Our Compact Against Hate with @adl_national demonstrated our ability as mayors to combat hatred & bigotry in our cities. Our partnership w/ @naturbanleague brought mayors together w/ civil rights orgs to push for equity & inclusion in institutions & political systems #uscm2018

With the support of @mikebloomberg & @bloombergdotorg we amplified mayors’ voices from across the country on the issues that matter to our cities and ensured that millions of Americans understand the power of your leadership. #uscm2018

Mayors advocate for a fair & safe immigration system and told stories of Dreamers that work, play, and serve in our communities. Each time the President and the Attorney General have threatened so-called “sanctuary cities”, we have stood against these divisive attacks #uscm2018

Mayors have pushed for bigger investments in infrastructure and put Americans to work. We have pushed for common sense gun safety laws, worked w/ our police chiefs to promote fair & safe policing, and addressed the culture of violence in our schools & communities. #uscm2018

Thank you to @usmayors staff. I have been fortunate to work alongside you for the past year and witnessed your commitment & continued hard work. Thank you, @tcochran_mayors, for your partnership, a lifetime of service & leadership, and devotion to our nation’s mayors. #uscm2018

Thank you to every Mayor across the country for placing your confidence in me over the past year, and for everything you do every day. America is truly great because of the passion you have for the people you serve. #uscm2018

“I am sorry” and “I forgive you” are the six most important words when we deal with race. And that doesn’t require us to litigate fault. We may not all be at fault but we all have a responsibility to seek and find common ground and to move forward.
On the question of monuments, we have to ask- why are they there? Who put them up? For what purpose? Do they reflect who we are?   Only when we consider all of our history can we truly move forward.
I wrote #IntheShadowofStatues to provoke a conversation on race.  You cannot go over it or under it or around it, you have to go through it.

column5: Go Pels! Huge win tonight. Series evens up on Sunday! #doitBIGGER https://t.co/5ysEh0SrGD
I ran into some friends while saying thank you to our dedicated city employees. https://t.co/pUhCqyRmwJ
I stopped by to answer a few 311 calls today.  Thanks to our hardworking 311 staff for connecting the people of New Orleans to services over the past 8 years! https://t.co/gCSsmMvjMR
Thanks to the @NOLACityCouncil for your partnership over the past eight years.  Your dedication to our people has been vital in our effort to rebuild this great American city. https://t.co/gnoCSADqXn
RT @NOLA300th: We unveiled a legacy gift to #NOLA, the Will and the Way, a collection of stories of progress from the past 8 yrs. + a remin…
RT @NOLA300th: #NOLA loves attracting new business and growing local business, boasting wins like @GEDTechNOLA and @DXCTechnology. Since @b…

Thanks to partnership of @WoodwardDB, Carpenter & Co. Coaxum Enterprises, Beacon Capital Partners, Jackson Offshore & Cascade Investments, @FourSeasonsNOLA will soon be a reality. This project is a strong capstone on our work together over last 8 years. #NOLAWillandWay
It’s official - we have broken ground on the new @FourSeasonsNOLA. The last of a massive list of redevelopment projects we’ve done together. Great job NOLA! https://t.co/uuks2ig7ZX
.@FourSeasonsNOLA will include an exhibit space feat. History of African Americans in LA and celebrating jazz and our culture, curated by Harvard Scholar @HenryLouisGates.

Rebirth of former World Trade Center building as the @FourSeasonsNOLA has officially begun. It takes a great team to make a dream project like this happen. New Orleans is on a roll! #NOLAProud https://t.co/1mbx1PvveK

Our hard work will continue through the rest of 2018 as the City will be break ground on 21 projects worth $78M and cut the ribbon on 21 projects worth $71M. Together, we have rebuilt a great ​American city and laid a foundation for ​the future.

When we took office in 2010, we hit reset button on our recovery. In 8 years, we completed over 200 capital projects totaling almost $350M. Parks, playgrounds, libraries, ​police and fire stations, rec ​centers and so much more. Touching every neighborhood in ​this great city.

.@FourSeasonsNOLA is nearly $500M project that will maximize City’s return on investment, create 1,600 construction jobs & 450 permanent jobs and be a demand generator that attracts further investment. Developer fully committed to significant DBE participation of 35%. Huge win! https://t.co/QbEbAByqKn

Today we officially break ground on  @FourSeasonsNOLA! 2 Canal St. is unmistakable part of #NOLA skyline. It will once again be a world class space for our world class city. Anchor our reimagined riverfront from Crescent Park to Riverwalk. Keep building! #NOLAProud https://t.co/ZvZ2YzKn8r
@TBob53 @TBob53 good one! 😂
Right now: @MayorLandrieu talks with @ttuckerwwl @WWLAMFM about eight years as mayor and progressive of city. https://t.co/hMo45KpDIc

More than 20K jobs have been added in NOLA since 2010. In November we announced @DXCTechnology chose NOLA, delivering 2,000 jobs and the biggest tech project in state history. Great to see the final touches being made on new @DXCTechnology home in our city! https://t.co/ZX3jN7y9B7

column5: Charles Neville was an incredible musical talent who will be dearly missed. As @jazzfest kicks off this weekend, we’ll keep “Charlie the horn man” and the entire Neville Family in our thoughts and prayers. #NOLAProud https://t.co/X2Wzm2tyHf

. @ceasefirenola participant Ruffin Johnson: I know what it feels like on all sides of this: I’ve been shot and I’ve been incarcerated. After I was shot, I was going to retaliate and CeaseFire stopped me. Now, I’ve gotten two degrees and I’m involved with @ceasefirenola. https://t.co/EM24svg7Zf

. @UMCNO Dr. Jen Avegno: @ceasefirenola has partnered w/ UMC over past 4 yrs. They are on call 24/7 when a shooting occurs to prevent retaliation and be w/ patient to extend a helping hand from someone they know. They’ve prevented at least 75 retaliatory shootings #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/foSIj4p3Qn

Thanks @nola_for_life Awards recipients for your partnership in tackling our crime problem in different areas. @TCAnola @CBANOLA1892 @cafereconcile @yepnola @thenetnola @fipvotenola @100blackmennola @cisneworleans @goodwillsela Council on Alcohol and Drug Abuse @STRIVEIntl #NOLA https://t.co/o5WHl7Y9zR

@ceasefirenola participant Ruffin Johnson: I know what it feels like on all sides of this: I’ve been shot and I’ve been incarcerated. After I was shot, I was going to retaliate and CeaseFire stopped me. Now, I’ve gotten two degrees and I’m involved with @ceasefirenola. https://t.co/nbOWkYoqbX

@UMCNO Dr. Jen Avegno: @ceasefirenola has partnered w/ UMC over past 4 yrs. They are on call 24/7 when a shooting occurs to prevent retaliation and be w/ patient to extend a helping hand from someone they know. They’ve prevented at least 75 retaliatory shootings. #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/cZJrdq2WxT

Violence is a public health issue that is preventable, not inevitable. It is amazing what we have accomplished together over past 8 yrs., & I encourage all of you to keep working toward building a city of peace. It’s up to you to continue to make us truly great. #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/ej3n75B4S2

In 2010, we invited DOJ to enter a consent decree w @NOPDnews. Since then, we launched 17 new recruit classes & graduated 393 new officers bringing total manpower to over 1,200. We restructured NOPD pay and now NOPD is 2nd-highest paid dept in the state after state police. https://t.co/UuQu2rCq47

Thank you for listening to my insane request, to run toward the fire. The pipelines that used to produce kids who went to jail now produced kids who go onto the NFL or to college. #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/slr0iJ8Ie8

CAO & DM Judy Reese Morse: When the Mayor took office, we had to address crime problem in our city. We had to take a holistic approach. Since we began our murder reduction strategy @Nola_For_Life 6 yrs. ago, murder rate is 30% lower than 6 yrs. before it began. #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/kJmh6pZtsY

Thankful for the local media in our city. They are some of the best in the business and play an important and sacred role in building a strong community. @TraversWDSU, @1AVPro, @MeganMackel, @DMassaWWL, @EPaulsenWWL, @lbjnola, @robmassonfox8 https://t.co/jX4fN1CBny
Honored to talk w/ great reporters about our work together to rebuild NOLA & lay a foundation for future. @WWLTV @wdsu @FOX8NOLA @WGNOtv https://t.co/Kt8ItzARJS

column5: New Orleans and southeast Louisiana deserve the best and the new @NO_Airport will be the best. We can’t wait to welcome the rest of the world to this world-class facility soon! #TheNewMSY #NOLA300 #OneTimeinNOLA https://t.co/eQSEmP7fss

The people of New Orleans have the will and know the way to make #NOLA the city we know she can be. This new airport is one of the most tangible developments in our status as an international city. #NOLAwillandway @no_airport

This airport is the front door to the #nola culture visitors experience. The city’s culture industries account for nearly 40,000 jobs & earned $1.3B in 2016. There are over 100 annual festivals, which generate an economic impact of $904 million. #TheNewMSY #NOLA300 #OneTimeinNOLA https://t.co/UyFo8GN8bv

The new airport will have a single security checkpoint the length of a football field. Centralizing other aspects of airport operation like food and beverage, news and gifts, baggage claim, and parking will make trips through the airport easier for everyone @no_airport https://t.co/EfQWmsEmbo

In 2014 we broke ground, & in 2019 we will celebrate the opening of this nearly $1B investment in a new airport that will be integral to our success as a world-class travel destination. @no_airport #TheNewMSY #NOLA300 #OneTimeinNOLA https://t.co/q7R9Ff1Rrk
I’m so excited to be back at @NO_Airport to celebrate this new construction milestone and celebrate our culture and hospitality industries. https://t.co/HO8hR2rKC0
column6: Place(name='Kenner', bounding_box=BoundingBox(coordinates=[[[-90.285434, 29.969126], [-90.221258, 29.969126], [-90.221258, 30.049577], [-90.285434, 30.049577]]], type='Polygon', _api=<tweepy.api.API object at 0x7fabbfbed940>), full_name='Kenner, LA', attributes={}, place_type='city', url='https://api.twitter.com/1.1/geo/id/6e5c7d7cfdf8a6b7.json', contained_within=[], country_code='US', id='6e5c7d7cfdf8a6b7', country='United States', _api=<tweepy.api.API object at 0x7fabbfbed940>)

column5: RT @NewOrleansBA: Excellent #NOLAtech news: @iMeritDigital chose #NOLA to open its 1st U.S. delivery center. It's a digital #data services…

This week New Orleans celebrated @NOLA300th. Today I had the honor of thanking President @EmmanuelMacron for #France’s support of our Tricentennial. Vive la France. Vive la Nouvelle-Orléans. 
🇺🇸🇫🇷 @StateDept https://t.co/Apc4efW7mW

column5: Sunday, I was honored to be appointed as an Officer of the Legion of Honor by #France President @EmmanuelMacron. New Orleans was honored to welcome Minister of State Jean-Baptiste Lemoyne for @NOLA300th. https://t.co/nVq0lv6E8g
RT @theadvocateno: With New Orleans jail population cut in half, here's how trend can continue, Landrieu's office says https://t.co/cxPlM2J…

Proud to release the @Safety_Justice Challenge Annual Report highlighting #NOLA’s jail reduction successes including reducing the jail’s average daily population to its lowest in nearly 40 years. @macfound View the full report: https://t.co/2RJByZclkV https://t.co/zKweMpKHwG

Thank you to the variety of performers who joined us to celebrate #NOLA300 on Saturday. You reminded us that it is our diversity that makes us unique and valuable to the world and to the country. @nola300th https://t.co/T45PbO1Elr
https://t.co/oDdtthGlIH

Thank you to the leaders from around the world who joined us to celebrate our Tricentennial on Saturday. Your nations contributed to the unique #NOLA culture we are known for today. #NOLA300 @nola300th https://t.co/fhn474YPF0

Thank you to all of the men and women who serve in our military forces. Our Tricentennial #NOLA300 was so much richer because of the contributions of military personnel from across the world. @marineband @nolanavyweek @NOLA300th https://t.co/WPsvgdRaLN
Tonight, First Lady Cheryl Landrieu and I spent time on USS Kearsarge with dedicated military personnel. Thanks for your service #nola300 https://t.co/zqhc3B1uJw
The bond between New Orleans & France is enduring. Proud to welcome Minister of State Jean-Baptist Lemoyne to #Nola300. @FranceLouisiana https://t.co/Ulgv8pjPfk
It’s great to take part in International Jazz Day Concert with @herbiehancock and my friend @T_Blanchard #nola300 https://t.co/0VXhpAOwR8

column5: After @PelicansNBA win, Owner Gayle Benson shared with us @NOLA300th Tricentennial International Dinner. Thanks for your leadership. https://t.co/RsD3rdJ0XH

column5: Another great moment as we celebrate @NOLA300th! Congrats @PelicansNBA! https://t.co/53k7Gw14cq
RT @JoseRCabanas: #NewOrleans shows in its 300th Anniversary how we all come from the same origins #Haiti #Cuba #Spain #France #Africa http…

All of us have a great enduring spirit that will carry us through the next 300 years by following the path that is right before us. We have shown that we have the will and that we now have the way. Happy birthday #NOLA. I love you. #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/OmHBctQffX

New Orleans will thrive because we have become the embodiment of what President Obama called the “character of our country”—our ability to recognize that we are all in this together and that we cannot go forward at all unless we do it together. #NOLAWillandWay

We are positioning ourselves to be leaders in the 21st century—thousands of new jobs, new, world-class @NO_airport, revitalized riverfront, new schools and hospitals, rebuilt gyms, community centers, and playgrounds. Investment in all neighborhoods across the city #NOLAWillandWay

On the balcony of City Hall, Pres. John F. Kennedy said that “New Orleans has long represented the strength of diversity working in harmony.”  It is our diversity and our pride in it that makes #NOLA so dynamic, so vital to the U.S. & the world. #NOLAWillandWay https://t.co/BLAccb9jIk

#NOLA was the setting for Civil Rights triumphs that set our nation on the long, slow road to equality: where Homer Plessy took on Jim Crow, Rev. A.L. Davis and a young Dr. King launched the Southern Christian Leadership Conference & Ruby Bridges pushed past ‘separate but equal’

This city’s strategic placement made it worth fighting over and nations did, but the flags that flew over New Orleans never totally dictated the nature or the culture of this place and its people. We are singularly unique in the world's cultural landscape. #nola2018 https://t.co/T2EKo2vLoO

Few American cities have reached such an historic milestone. We have faced many challenges, tragedies and triumphs. The soul of our city, now the soul of the nation, is deeply rooted in this shared history that has evolved over centuries. #nola2018 https://t.co/FU5iYhn4mW
Honored to welcome First Lady of Haiti Madame Martine Moïse @martinejmoise for #NOLA300th. Haiti and #NOLA have a unique shared history and renew their bonds today. #NOLAProud https://t.co/a8ISFjBJuA
@FranceLouisiana Consul General @VincentSciama providing remarks at #NOLA300th celebration. #NOLA and France share a special relationship that is everlasting. https://t.co/1QaqGxRsKP
RT @LouisianaGov: It’s great to be in New Orleans this morning with @MayorLandrieu for the #NOLA300th celebration. This city captures the u…

Join us on this beautiful #NOLA morning as we celebrate and reflect upon the @NOLA300th. Welcome to all of the international dignitaries, mayors from around the world who have come to celebrate with us today! #nolaproud https://t.co/nk4dFoYRYn
#NOLA300th begins with our @USMarineCorps Band. Honored to be joined by @LouisianaGov John Bel Edwards and so many dignitaries from around the world. https://t.co/V1Fk9dhh1V
It’s great to welcome so many great New Orleanians and friends to @NOLA300th Tricentennial Welcome Ceremony. https://t.co/NHI66iLstN

column5: The one and only @PresHall Jazz Band welcoming everyone as we kickoff #NOLA300th celebration. No one knows how to throw a party like our beautiful city! #NOLAProud https://t.co/WvL1XZONlg
It’s a beautiful morning and the stage is set. We’re ready to celebrate @NOLA300th! #NOLAProud https://t.co/VivvjgP7hA
Staging going up for tomorrow’s @NOLA300th Tricentennial International Welcome Ceremony! https://t.co/1MpERIVwtw

column5: I’m very happy to sit with my friend @mikeallen to discuss the will & the way of New Orleans. Thank you to @axios for producing this event in honor of #NOLA300 https://t.co/MXXWD4jw7d

column5: Excited to host @nolanavyweek in time for our @2018nola Tricentennial celebration! 6 ships and nearly 2000 Sailors, Marines, Coast Guardsmen, and Tall Ship Crews. Vessels from United Kingdom and Canada. Welcome and thank you for your service! https://t.co/XJfyubNAae
RT @NOLA300th: Tomorrow is #VoicesofCongoSquare, an official Tricentennial event. Don't miss it! https://t.co/jYE9U4H0At https://t.co/Hhq17…
3-0 @PelicansNBA! I feel a sweep coming. #PelicansGameday #nola300 https://t.co/FHPNSRMPDD
I am greatly humbled by this honor. Like our other accolades, this is truly a reflection of the great work and progress of the people of New Orleans. #NOLAProud #NOLA300 https://t.co/mY3TTuGPXJ

Proud of our Next 300 Challenge Award recipients. Change-makers w solutions to address some of our city’s greatest challenges. Grateful for our partners @WK_Kellogg_Fdn @SouthwestAir for standing w us as we work to improve #NOLA. The next 300 years are looking great! @2018nola https://t.co/bg9tnuF6Dq
Tania Tetlow: @NOPDNews is the only agency I know that when criticized, invites you in to help them get better. #EpicConference https://t.co/9e8cgCy6md

column5: RT @NOPDNews: #NOPD Chief is welcoming law enforcement leaders from around the country to discuss, EPIC, NOPD’s innovative peer-interventio…
Today we had our final Editorial Board Meetings w/ @NOLAnews & @theadvocateno. Grateful for the key role journalism plays in our community. https://t.co/usPvm92xlN
column6: Place(name='New Orleans', bounding_box=BoundingBox(coordinates=[[[-90.137908, 29.889574], [-89.884108, 29.889574], [-89.884108, 30.075628], [-90.137908, 30.075628]]], type='Polygon', _api=<tweepy.api.API object at 0x7fabbfbed940>), full_name='New Orleans, LA', attributes={}, place_type='city', url='https://api.twitter.com/1.1/geo/id/dd3b100831dd1763.json', contained_within=[], country_code='US', id='dd3b100831dd1763', country='United States', _api=<tweepy.api.API object at 0x7fabbfbed940>)

column5: Thank you to @DXCTechnology’s Terrell Boynton for discussing the largest economic development announcement in #NOLA’s modern history. Out of over 30 cities, DXC Technology has chosen to locate in New Orleans, which will create thousands of jobs. https://t.co/wN6NNzDo1T

Austin Sherman and Alexis Korman w/ @BigEasyBucha feel they’ve gotten to bottle the #NOLA magic and that their partnership w/ StriveNOLA, to provide jobs to STRIVE grads, has been essential to their business. Now their product can be found in over 1500 stores. https://t.co/bdA323ayeG

Matt Findley w/ @Inxile_Ent: The enthusiasm we’ve experienced for the technology industry in #NOLA is incredible. We had access to talented people who may have never taken the leap to move elsewhere. https://t.co/YwMwuFVWWu

The Will and the Way is a compilation of the accomplishments people and businesses of #NOLA have made by working together over the last 8 yrs. It’s important to take stock of all we’ve done. This is another legacy gift to the people of #NOLA for #NOLA300. https://t.co/jVbi8HGavn https://t.co/cOc3SAJO3C

It takes an entire city to grow and diversify an economy. Thank you to all of our supporters and partners like @GNOinc and @NewOrleansBA. We focused on how you create jobs as well as how you attract jobs. Our entrepreneurial spirit is now cemented in our culture.

The first step in rebuilding was to stop saying that we are recovering. For the past 8 yrs., we have been creating the city we wanted to become. We have accomplished so much together. #NOLAproud https://t.co/9Kh4flDHi8

Angelica Rivera w/ @ColmexNOLA has worked in cities around the world but never found the support that she found here in #NOLA. Not only is her company able to build on their own success but they are able to help other small businesses succeed. @GS10KSmallBiz https://t.co/mjrgUdtzbV

Tonight we unveil the Will and the Way campaign. This celebrates how the accomplishments of the last eight years have set us on a path that allows you, the people of #NOLA, to continue progress and become the city we know we can be.
Great to network with the business and local leaders who have worked with us to set #NOLA on a great path forward over the past 8 years. https://t.co/Zds8Oec3JI

New Orleanians, benches on the pedestrian mall between Jackson Square and the Cabildo have been temporarily removed in preparation for our Tricentennial International Welcome Ceremony event that will be held this Saturday. The benches will be returned once the ceremony is over.
Geaux @PelicansNBA! Great win. See y’all back in NOLA for Game 3 Thursday. https://t.co/NFY5qkJE3C

column5: First Lady Barbara Bush was a strong woman who embodies grace and determination. She was an example for many young ladies. My deepest condolences to the Bush family.
No better way to end the @2018nola Tricentennial Interfaith Service. Thanks to all of the faith community who came out. https://t.co/26Dkex6nSG

Everywhere we look in Washington, we find elected officials who say they are guided by faith, family, and country.  They even use their faith to justify some of their political positions.  But the bible I read teaches that faith without work is dead.   #LRsafetysummit
I'm confident the American people will get it right.  Because we've gotten it right before. #LRsafetysummit
Violence is a public health threat, just like it is a public safety threat. #LRcommunitysafetysummit https://t.co/DN2Ja4zyxm

column5: Thank you to the #nola2018 commission, the craftspeople, construction workers, and everyone else who made the restoration of Gallier Hall a reality. #nolatricentennial

From preservation of furnishings to selecting artwork, First Lady Landrieu restored Gallier Hall to its former glory. Thank you to those who worked w her to make this happen. Because of your hard work Gallier Hall will serve as the landmark for #NOLA. #nola2018 #nolatricentennial https://t.co/4Akw7SROk6

Today we celebrate the rededication of Gallier Hall. Throughout the restoration, people have had sneak peaks. But, today we are in the Ty Tracy Theatre, which was the final piece of the restoration, making Gallier’s restoration complete. #2018nola #nolatricentennial https://t.co/gaqYDWrWCB

Successful crime fighting takes all hands on deck. We are committed to investing in prevention – pillar #2 of @NOLA_FOR_LIFE. This expansion will help us continue turn around the lives of at-risk youth, which is critical to our city’s future. https://t.co/TKQmJXTfFy

The City remains very proud of the investment because we believe that our youth, regardless of position in life, should have access to the best opportunities. We understand that it is not about where you are—but where you finish.

We are proud to continue our investment in our youth and break ground on the 28-bed expansion of the Youth Study Center. This allows all juvenile offenders – no matter the charge – to be housed at the Youth Study Center instead of the Orleans Justice Center. https://t.co/F3zY9tz1Uy

In the face of challenge and uncertainty in the U.S. - from the Women’s March to Black Lives Matter to the Me Too Movement, & the amazing students at Stoneman Douglas High— we must stay committed to the courageous leadership that improves lives & solves real problems. #Kerner50

Thank you @HaasInstitute @JohnsHopkins @EconomicPolicy and @UCBerkeley for having me today. #Kerner50 is a stark reminder that now more than ever, America needs courageous leaders again to tackle issues like race, economic equity, & gun violence.
RT @HaasInstitute: That arc of justice does not bend on its own, it needs someone to bend it. @MayorLandrieu #kerner5
RT @HaasInstitute: We need leaders who will face the truth and then lead us on a new pathway forward. @MayorLandrieu #kerner5
RT @HaasInstitute: Kerner Commission Report is a stark reminder that America needs courageous leaders to tackle everything from gun control…
RT @HaasInstitute: .@MayorLandrieu giving a forceful defense of sensible gun contol at #kerner5
RT @HaasInstitute: We do not have deficits of ideas in this country, we have deficits of courage. @MayorLandrieu #kerner5
RT @HaasInstitute: .@MayorLandrieu in his opening remarks at #Kerner50 at @UCBerkeley https://t.co/HX3NUrRgJP
RT @HaasInstitute: These statues do not represent history, they are an affront to it. We all have to keep pushing. @MayorLandrieu #kerner5
RT @HaasInstitute: The monuments were erected well after the War...to send a strong reminder to all that the confederacy was still in charg…
RT @HaasInstitute: I understand the moment all too well, when a white politician finally understands institutional racism. @MayorLandrieu…
RT @HaasInstitute: I am in awe of the courage it took for Kerner Commission to tell the truth. The foresight to tell what is, and what was,…
RT @HaasInstitute: We can only go forward together, towards a more perfect union, ONLY if we're honest about our past and how we got here.…
RT @HaasInstitute: Anything but the whole truth can lead us to a lie by omission - @MayorLandrieu #Kerner5
RT @HaasInstitute: Welcome to #Kerner5 Day 3! We're thrilled to have @MayorLandrieu, mayor of New Orleans, kick off the final day. Mayor La…

Thank you, the citizens of #NOLA , for pushing us and demanding more. Thank you for having a commitment to our city. I challenge you to continue the work as my team departs. Think about building the city of our dreams. https://t.co/tmmr1lVMlJ

We have jumpstarted our rebuilding, and we are the nation’s most immediate laboratory for innovation and change. We’ve landed great businesses and created thousands of new jobs. Together, we have shown the world what resilience looks like.
I want to thank #NOLA citizens for giving me the opportunity to serve as your mayor for 1,392 days, my administration has committed to tackling and making progress on tough challenges.

Without a full embrace of inclusion, the business climate in our city will fail to meet its full potential. We are seeing throughout the world that companies and organizations see inclusion as a strategic growth strategy that yields significant dividends to their bottom line.

We should absolutely celebrate our successes. I am proud of the work we’ve done together.  But we must be honest about government’s capacity to change the markets. Govt. on its best day cannot solve this problem on its own.

As we celebrate our tricentennial and think about our city’s next 300 years, we have to acknowledge that without buy-in and partnership of the business community, #NOLA will never have real economic equity. #NOLATricentennial

Too often, we talk about equity merely as an end in itself. It’s a worthy goal. We should always work to expand opportunity and be as inclusive as possible when doing business. Economic disparity in any community has cascading negative impacts that are felt by all.
While city govt. has largely delivered on our goals of inclusion in contracting, and other institutions are enacting their own programs, economic stratification in our city has not slowed down.

I’d like to applaud the @NewOrleansENMCC, @PortNOLA, and the Louisiana Stadium and Exposition District for their recent work towards a more equitable economy. In the past year, these organizations created and began to operate their own DBE programs.
Let me be clear: this is not about charity. We are helping people to realize the potential they already had, which makes them assets to their employers and our community.

These jobseekers, specifically African-American males, are then connected to opportunities with participating Anchor Institutions. Over 300 grads have completed Strive, w/ a 75% employment rate. #StriveNOLA grads are now in career-track positions and providing for their families

Some anchor institutions go a step further, and work w/ #StriveNOLA on job placement. #StriveNOLA is a holistic effort to connect disadvantaged jobseekers to employment opportunities through a rigorous, four-week job training program.

I’d like to thank our anchor institution partners like @LCMCHealth, the New Orleans Aviation Board, @LSUHealthNO, @OchsnerHealth, the Sewerage and Water Board, Southeast Louisiana Veterans Health Care System, @TulaneNews, and @XULA1925 for your partnership in this important work.

The Network for Economic Opportunity, now housed at @NewOrleansBA, meets quarterly with some of our city’s largest employers as part of the Anchor Collaborative, who reviews progress and works to ensure that workforce training meets their labor needs.

Some may view an inclusionary contracting process as burdensome, as something that will weigh them down when they need to be agile and maintain the ability to act and react quickly.  However, there has been no drop-off in quality since we beefed up our DBE program.

One dispiriting conclusion of this study shows that while women- and minority-owned businesses make up a large part of the market, private investment disproportionately goes to firms owned by white men.

While it’s critically important that city govt. continue to perform well when it comes to awarding contracts to women- and minority-owned businesses, the hard truth is that govt. spending is only a small portion of overall spending in the entire marketplace.
Asian-American and Hispanic-owned firms are also awarded a disproportionately small share of city work.

The Disparity Study highlighted areas that the city can improve around construction contracts.  The study says that African American-owned construction firms make up 27% of the market; yet, they only get 11% of city construction contracts.

For the last 8 yrs, we have been working hard. These are just some of the results that we all should be proud of. While we’re happy to see that our work has shown success, we must acknowledge and work to fix areas where we still have room to improve.
Otis now has 8 fulltime employees and contracts with close to 30 other trucking owner-operators. They have been expanding and recently opened a second office.

Otis Tucker, owner of Trucking Innovation, LLC, was not getting the opportunity to work his way up through our local trucking industry. As a participant in the #BuildNOLA program, he sharpened his skills and gained the tools necessary to scale up. https://t.co/gAEA0j0yeF
This work has been about more than new programs and numbers. This has been about helping real people create new #PathwaysToProsperity.
City government processes have gotten better, too. The certification process for DBEs has been reduced from an average of nearly 2 yrs. to an average of 2 wks.

#BuildNOLA would not have been possible without our partners. Thank you to Quality Urban Equities, @NewCorp_Inc , @GoodworkNetwork, Urban League of Greater New Orleans, @SUNOKnights, @sbagov, The Association of General Contractors of Louisiana, and @Grainger.

#BuildNOLA prepares businesses for sustainable growth by focusing on increased revenues, new contracting opportunities, and job creation. Since its launch in 2015, it has created 74 new jobs and generated over $5M in public and private contracts to graduates.
Most @GS10KSmallBiz program businesses see an increase in revenues and hiring within 6 months of graduating. We thank two of our earliest partners, @GoldmanSachs and @DelgadoCC, for your support.
Through programs like @GS10KSmallBiz, #BuildNOLA, and its Mobilization Fund, we have invested in building the capacity of local businesses to take on larger contracts, in public and private sectors.

From 2014 thru today, $387M in DBE contracts have been awarded by the City, S&WB, @neworleansRTA and @NO_airport. Projects like Joe Brown Park Katrina repairs, Juvenile Justice Center, Lafitte Greenway, and N.O. East Hospital have between 35 and 40% DBE participation.

Today’s independent Disparity Study shows that while 41% of available local businesses are minority- and women-owned, 47% of city work went to DBEs. Because of our hard work, city government has over-performed, and this study validates our approach.

With @NOLACityCouncil and in partnership with groups like @TheCollab504 and community leaders like Barbara Major, we asked the people of #NOLA to amend the City Charter to strengthen DBE laws. That Charter Change passed in a landslide in 2014.
Thru the creation of the @NewOrleansBA, govt. and private industry set out to ensure that the city would have a single coordinated effort to deliver new jobs and spur economic opportunities for all.
Immediately, we set about reforming the city’s contracting practices to increase transparency and create additional opportunity for women- and minority-owned businesses.
When I came into office in 2010, we had our work cut out for us. While we have a long way to go, I am proud of the work we’ve accomplished.
You told us that the City’s DBE certification process was not widely known and too cumbersome.

You told us that the ability to even compete for govt. contracts was viewed as a waste for many small businesses because at City Hall “It wasn’t about what you know. Instead, it was about who you know.”

This report told us an inconvenient truth: progressive govt. policies and practices can be impactful, but w/o full buy-in and partnership with business community, we will not deliver real economic equity in #NOLA.

The disparity study confirmed many of the things we already knew to be true: the people of #NOLA are ready and able to work, and investing in them pays enormous dividends to our community by providing #PathwaysToProsperity. https://t.co/sgUWG4f08a

I want to give a special shout out to our Supplier Diversity staff; our many partners in the business, non-profit and philanthropic communities for their partnership; @TheCollab504 and so many minority-owned businesses for partnering w/ us to advance this important work.
Thank you to the many city employees who have worked w/ me over the last 8 yrs to strengthen our workforce, attract new businesses, and build up local and disadvantaged businesses in our city.
Watch live: Mayor Landrieu Hosts Conversation on Economic Equity to Release City’s Disparity Study Draft Report https://t.co/ut0dPAmTrj

Join me this afternoon for a conversation on economic equity in #NOLA as we release the City’s Disparity Study Draft Report and discuss how we can improve opportunities for women- and minority-owned businesses. RSVP here: https://t.co/nB7qLSlREz https://t.co/pEejTbYaRK
Thank you @SallyAnnWWL. You are a true NOLA Legend and we will miss you! We know that you will continue your great work throughout our city as a trusted voice & civic leader. https://t.co/gmyQ4oWQ6w

It's always a blast having @ZuluKrewe visit with us! Thank you for coming and getting us in the mood for Carnival 2018! #RealMardiGras https://t.co/9lpIhA5etR

column5: Thankful for our community partners for standing with us as we celebrate the Algiers Courthouse renovations! https://t.co/dZAl4eMq4f

The Historic Algiers Courthouse has been a pillar of the westbank & I’m glad to stand with our local, state and federal partners to cut ribbon on its new renovations – a 1.3M investment! https://t.co/CaZuU91Spb
Since 2010, we have completed 197 projects across #NOLA with 27 projects specifically on the westbank. We continue to invest in Algiers with more in the pipeline. https://t.co/JyKVcJSmLh
Thank you @TeamGleason for your inspiration and continued service. #NolaHero #GiveNola https://t.co/CZ6X4BSdEW

column5: Grateful for strong corporate citizens like @EntergyNOLA & Baptist Community Ministries for serving as the top spnonsors of #GiveNola Day https://t.co/LRiA3U5oEh

As we approach the City’s 300th anniversary, we look forward to even greater success with GiveNOLA Day and continuing to work with our non-profit community to create the city of our dreams. @GNOFoundation https://t.co/fYGL7Zci3Y

column5: With the help of a number of incredible non-profit organizations, we have been able to rebuild after Hurricane Katrina and tackle some of the City’s biggest challenges. In #NOLA, we understand the true strength of the philanthropic community. @GNOFoundation
Over the past four years, GiveNOLA Day has donated more than $15 million to support regional non-profit organizations. We look forward to continuing that strong impact. @GNOFoundation #GiveNola
When a lot of people give a little, we can raise millions for some incredible NOLA non-profits. #GiveNola

column5: Dr. Joseph Kanter, Director of @nolahealthdept, reminds residents and visitors of Mardi Gras safety tips. Visit https://t.co/TwH9s9nZKg for updates throughout Mardi Gras 2018. https://t.co/V2mTs52tgO

@ericajohnson27 @NO_Airport Erica, @NO_Airport experienced a water line break on Concourse C. The leak has stopped & some areas of the concourse are closed as crews clean the area.We're working to determine the cause so repairs can be made.The airport has not experienced significant impacts to air service.
RT @washingtonpost: "Trump has revealed who he is. Now it’s our turn." https://t.co/9CVNF2a8rT via @PostOpinions

And we make it easy to get here - @NO_Airport was named the #2 fastest growing airport in the country by AJOT! Over 12 million passengers were served in 2017 and we’ve added new international flights - the first since 1982. Not to mention, our new terminal opens in February 2019.

Not to mention, #NOLA is having a yearlong celebration for our best birthday yet - we’re turning 300 and @smithsonian named us the #1 Anniversary Worth Travelling For This Year! Come help us celebrate and see for yourself why we’re top of the rankings!
.@NatGeoTravel recognized #NOLA as #6 on their list of Best Cities in the United States. We’re a small city, but the “charm and authenticity” of our local businesses is having a big impact!

.@NYT recognized #NOLA as the #1 place to visit in 2018! Calling us a “one-of-a-kind” American city - our culture is a melting pot & our unique diversity of languages, food, and music makes us a must visit destination.

Over the past month, #NOLA has been nationally recognized as a top city to visit in the US. That’s because we’re building the city of our dreams - celebrating diversity, focusing on public safety, rebuilding neighborhoods, & our economy is as strong as ever.

Special thanks to residents who came out and removed over 75 ladders on parade routes. Yesterday, the City had to remove only 7 ladders and 6 pieces of scaffolding. #GoodNeighbors #MardiGras2018 https://t.co/qZgXk3JbgY
Pushing immigrants into the shadows makes the task of protecting cities more difficult for law enforcement. If crimes go unreported, criminals go free. #SOTU #Mayors
We have a $4.6T infrastructure backlog in country. POTUS’ plan won’t go far enough to reach the ground. Washington must GO BIG OR GO HOME.

column5: RT @usmayors: "The fact is the economy is doing better because America's cities remain the driving force of the American economy" - @MayorL…

Do not set up ladders and other personal items on the neutral ground and public rights of way ahead of parades. Leaving them overnight is prohibited and is subject to be removed by City crews. We ask all residents and visitors to be courteous to others as we celebrate #MardiGras. https://t.co/gO8ufZ9DpQ

From all our public safety partners, do not drink and drive. Obey the law, be courteous, and enjoy this years #MardiGras season. @NewOrleansEMS @NOLAFireDept @NOPDNews @LAStatePolice https://t.co/1lSGUD2dlt

Pay attention to road closures, #MardiGras enforcement and other news. All information can be found on https://t.co/hNqGkabv1f. You can also text MARDIGRAS to 888777 for updates and safety info from the City. #NOLA
Parking is always difficult during #MardiGras season so I encourage residents to make a plan before heading to parades. #NOLA
Up to 700 City employees and temporary workers will be cleaning our streets along with 100 pieces of equipment during events, as well as before and after parades. #NOLA
@NOPDNews will be on the streets at 100% capacity throughout the city, complemented by 165 officers from @LAStatePolice and officers from other local and federal agencies. #NOLA

Excited to announce the City’s 2018 #MardiGras preparations. Each year, #MardiGras brings millions of visitors to the city and generates as much as $500 million in economic impact. #NOLA https://t.co/oT6bq5dofA
Today @MayorLandrieu and Mayor-Elect @LaToya_Cantrell lead a Table Top Briefing in preparation of Mardi Gras 2018. https://t.co/GPx8i8su0Z

column5: It was great to help raise money for @NOPDNews horse breeding program w/ @LAHospFound at the Horse, Hops & Cops fundraiser tonight. https://t.co/E25OEnX6WR
RT @Americans4Arts: We're honored to recognize two time Tony Award winning actor Michael @cerveris the 2018 Citizen Artist award. "The most…
Thanks @StacyHeadNOLA for the partnership. #OneTeam https://t.co/B2zGKXYztC

Together, we've brought NORDC forward. Since 2010, it’s been the seniors in this neighborhood who brought Hollygrove back after Katrina. Thank you Vic Richard and @NORDCommission for your hard work. -Councilmember Susan Guidry https://t.co/z4kFHTG7Z8

Today, we cut the ribbon on improvements at Conrad Playground in the Hollygrove Neighborhood. Improvements like this help us expand and improve public green space and increase neighborhood revitalization through state-of-the-art parks, playgrounds and facilities. https://t.co/W429ih8EC3

Dr. Joseph Kanter, Director, @nolahealthdept talks to @WWLTV's @megfarrisWWL about this year's active flu season. Tune in to @WWLTV at 5 p.m. to learn about how you can take precautions against contracting the flu. https://t.co/px6wHLaLFz
After cleaning, crews identified which catch basins needed repairs. 25 catch basin repair crews are assigned to neighborhoods across the City five days a week and have already repaired 2000.
We completed the cleaning project on budget. Crews removed 6,409,560 pounds of debris from catch basins, which included over 93,000 pounds of Mardi Gras beads alone.

After major flooding in early August, DPW prioritized catch basin cleaning-- reassigning in house crews to focus on cleanings and requesting approval from @nolacitycouncil for a $22M Emergency Catch Basin Cleaning and Repair Program. https://t.co/fbBQpKJnn7

Here in #NOLA and throughout Louisiana, were are experiencing a severe flu season. On Jan. 31, the @LADeptHealth is offering free flu shots at Delgado Personal Health Clinic (517 N Rampart St.). Visit https://t.co/nkE2C0MIn9 for free vaccination locations throughout the state.
My deepest condolences to the family of former Councilmember and Community Leader Johnny Jackson, Jr.

column5: .@NatGeoTravel recognizes #NOLA among best U.S. cities  https://t.co/sNRe8CQbjB
RT @nolaready: Reminder #NOLA residents: water pressure is still not back to everyday levels. Help restore pressure: conserve water as much…
RT @SWBNewOrleans: New Orleans Residents Strongly Urged to Limit Water Use, Precautionary Boil Water Advisory Lifted for New Orleans East h…
RT @nolaready: Boil water advisory lifted for East Bank & Lower 9. Water safe to consume. Advisory for NOLA East remains in effect. See htt…

And again, I would like to thank New Orleanians and our visitors for your patience and cooperation throughout this prolonged weather event. While this has been a challenging week, we are all working together to repair the damage to our water system and return to business as usual

As you heard from @LouisianaGov  yesterday, this is a challenge impacting 28 parishes across the state who have issued Boil Water Advisories. We’re all experiencing similar water pressure challenges due to the prolonged freezing.
We now have high enough water pressure on the entire east bank for the @LADeptHealth to begin testing water samples. We should begin to get results within 24 hrs.
All residents and property owners should inspect their property for leaks. Just because your faucet turns on, does not mean you don’t have a leak somewhere in your system.

Even though water pressure increased overnight, we still urge everyone to limit water usage as much as possible. There is no reason to drip your water anymore.  There are no more freezes in the forecast for the foreseeable future.

While water pressure across the east bank has been steadily increasing since yesterday, the Boil Water Advisory is still in effect. Please continue to limit water usage and take all precautions necessary.

While many families and businesses are still feeling the freeze’s impact on water pressure, we are in a much better position today than we were yesterday. Temps have risen. All of our roads and bridges are open. The airport is fully operational. And water pressure is rising. https://t.co/b90HJ5Z0V3
HAPPENING NOW: Mayor Landrieu, City Officials provide updates on winter weather response https://t.co/V2t4seF9lr
RT @NO_Airport: Winter Weather Update: Water pressure in the Airport was restored overnight, and all restrooms in the airport terminal are…
RT @nolaready: Due to low water pressure, many dialysis clinics have closed and are rescheduling patients at other locations. Dialysis pati…

The City's EOC remains active and will continue to coordinate with the Governor's Office of Homeland Security and regional partners. The City's freeze plan remains in effect. - Aaron Miller, Director, NOHSEP

We are urging residents to continue to limit water usage to necessities only. Temperatures are beginning to rise and threat of pipes freezing at homes and businesses has decreased dramatically. Continuing to run faucets is no longer necessary.
All city facilities and schools will remain closed for a third day and will not open tomorrow, Jan. 19.

Thank you to our New Orleanians and our visitors for your patience and cooperation throughout this prolonged weather event. We know that this has been a challenging couple of days, and we’re asking for everyone to continue to heed our guidance and work with us so that together. https://t.co/noMI1Xf1iR
Thank you to our @nolacitycouncil and regional leaders whom we collaborate with all year long to respond to emergencies.

Thank you to @Louisianagov for standing with us. I know Pres. @mikeYenni shares the sentiment: the State has been a great partner for local communities, especially in times of emergency. https://t.co/xat0wURaag

HAPPENING NOW: Mayor Landrieu, @louisianagov, @MikeYenni, and other regional and parish officials provide updates on winter weather impact on region 
https://t.co/V2t4seF9lr
.@MayorLandrieu, @LouisianaGov are briefed by state, regional and local leaders on challenges from the prolonged weather event. https://t.co/lc0Q04Tklq

Since 2010, we have been committed to ending homelessness in New Orleans. Together, have reduced homelessness by 90%.

column5: King’s dream was a bold and courageous blueprint of the hard work for which we are all called to follow.

As many young people say, Dr. King was “woke”. He dared us to see
the things that were right in front of us and to speak truth to power,
but to do so in love. https://t.co/3pue59vkC6
There is no way to go forward unless we go together. https://t.co/2ORrfEkVjH

column5: It is my honor to kickoff our Tricentennial Carnival Season with King’s Day! @ZuluKrewe @RexParade https://t.co/BK09r6MQDo

Have an idea about how to improve the quality of life in your neighborhood? Need funding to make your project happen? Good news! The Tricentennial Neighborhood Grant deadline has been extended to 1/19/18 at 5 p.m.! For more information & to apply visit: https://t.co/wS2X1lqZUk

Today, we are excited to create a new partnership between Classical Orléans and Nouvelle Orleans as sister cities. Through this partnership, we will work together to reinforce friendship and develop relationships between our cities. https://t.co/8s5wP7hMk6
It's been 300 years and our partnership & kinship with Orléans and France has never been stronger. https://t.co/jYbhOwavRz

Looking at the names of the cities of Orléans and New Orleans, we see that there is a natural connection. Considering our history and everything that we will be doing together in the future, this is going to be a long and prosperous relationship. – Mayor @Olivier_Carre https://t.co/3jNA7lZnSv

Excited to welcome Mayor @Olivier_Carre and the entire Orléans Delegation to #NOLA to further celebrate & pay tribute to the rich & historic ties that have developed over the past 300 years. @MetropolOrleans https://t.co/he3wfC0bII

Grateful to @Results4America for recognizing our work to create equitable distribution of @NewOrleansEMS ambulance vehicles to improve services. Since its start we've dropped response times during night shift & enhanced equity in response times. Study: https://t.co/YbSiBSWOlX

Thanks to @NewOrleansRTA and their construction contractors @BohBros I’m thrilled to say this project will provide more convenient access for our residents and the over 10 million tourists we serve each year. https://t.co/MoMTYy55GX

Cutting the ribbon this project shows what happens when you work together with federal, state and local partners to get the job done. The Cemeteries Transit Center will benefit our local businesses, residents & tourists; stimulating further development throughout the City. https://t.co/ZahYktIMRt
RT @FranceLouisiana: On Jan 5th 🇫🇷Orléans & 🇺🇸New Orleans will become sister cities! We're honored to have both Mayor Carré & Mayor Landrie…

We’ve installed over 80 crime cameras citywide with 250 more coming, 22 license plate readers with 80 more being installed soon. @NOPDNews is phasing in 285 new take home vehicles,and @NewOrleansEMS has purchased 16 new ambulances, and 6 new EMS sprint SUVs. https://t.co/WKn8XqcDxk

We’re hiring & training larger, more equipped first responders. Providing tools they need to patrol our streets, reduce crime & improve response times for emergencies. We’re doing this not only by ​growing, but by making smarter ​deployment decisions & increasing ​technology.
@NOLAFireDept has purchased 21 new fire trucks, 1 hazmat vehicle, and 117 sets of new personal protective equipment for the City’s fire department. https://t.co/1BGzD0zJPa
Since the launch of @NOLA_FOR_LIFE the murder rate is 29% lower and there have been about 140 fewer murders compared to the five and half years prior to NOLA FOR LIFE’s launch.
Today we’re highlighting the major Public Safety investments of 2017 and the major results they produced. A 10% reduction in murders and a 19% reduction in armed robberies. https://t.co/j55i5v8BMW
RT @nolaready: Icy roads reported in some areas of #NOLA this morning. Drive carefully and stay alert to road conditions. #streetwise #lawx
Congratulations to @alabamaFTBL for playing a tremendous game today! #sugarbowl #nola
Sending well wishes and good luck to the @alabamaFTBL and @clemsonFB teams and fans during the Allstate Sugar Bowl. There are few things sweeter than a bowl game in #NOLA!

As we enter 2018 and celebrate New Orleans’ 300th anniversary, I look forward to continuing to build the city of our dreams & lay a stronger foundation for our future. From my family to yours, I hope you have a Happy New Year's Day with much success and even greater opportunity. https://t.co/8GNGd0VUtH
RT @Saints: NFC SOUTH CHAMPS! #GoSaints https://t.co/4op2U6uP0E
Tune in now to ABC/WGNO to catch us live from the French Quarter in #NOLA. #rockinNYE

This year we made history and removed four monuments from prominent locations that didn’t reflect the richness & diversity of #NOLA. Together, we took a stand to turn a page on our divisive past and chart the course for a more inclusive future. https://t.co/Xun0nNuEfA

This past year, we launched the 16th class of @NOPDNews officers and added over 80 @NOLAFireDept firefighters. We remain committed to public safety and making sure that the residents of our city not only are safe, but feel safe. https://t.co/FMuUoFEzkZ

Today, we are excited to reopen the new bridge at Joe Brown Park. Infrastructure improvements like this help us deliver on our promise to rebuild every neighborhood back stronger. 
@NORDCommission @roadworknola @fema https://t.co/XPQ4X5elqZ

Together we are building stronger, more resilient infrastructure. Every success we’ve had in the past several years has been a result of strong partnership. Thank you to our partners at @fema, our community leaders and our construction workers for your hard work. @NORDCommission https://t.co/wqV2LFIkuj

This year was a strong year for infrastructure. DPW completed 31 projects, valued at $92M. Capital Projects completed 23 projects, bring the total value of capital projects completed since 2010 to $339M. https://t.co/4niaODOlAK

Excited to sign New Orleans’ 2018 Operating and Capital Budget. This budget focuses in on our priorities-Public Safety, Jobs, Opportunities for kids, Housing and Quality of Life. This is not only a budget, this is a roadmap for the future. https://t.co/6gGLUEbp3L

We can think of a better way to reform our tax code. Let’s call on Congress to slow down and get this effort right. Put the focus back on promoting investments in communities that have been left behind @cnbcopinion @reprichmond https://t.co/RjhvMoZLLY

Half of the country – including, but not limited to, cities and communities of color – was simply left out. This brand of politics and policy will only make our country more divided. @CNBCopinion @RepRichmond https://t.co/RjhvMoZLLY

The process that created this bill seemed more designed at ensuring it received the Republican votes it needed to pass than it did at building a broad, bipartisan coalition. @CNBCopinion @RepRichmond https://t.co/RjhvMoIano

By eliminating popular tax deductions and removing essential financing options and tax credits, the GOP tax bill would prove disastrous for middle class families and the cities they live, work and play in. @CNBCopinion @RepRichmond https://t.co/RjhvMoIano
Any tax reform bill should be measured by its potential to create jobs and strengthen our communities. This bill will do neither. @CNBCopinion @RepRichmond https://t.co/RjhvMoIano

Mayor Landrieu and Rep. Richmond: The Senate and House tax bills leave families in cities and communities of color behind. It's time to demand better. @CNBCopinion @RepRichmond https://t.co/RjhvMoZLLY

The new faces of @NOLAFireDept & @NOPDNews are prepared and ready. They’re joining departments that are well-trained and equipped. In my 2018 Budget, we’re increasing funding for both NOPD and NOFD. This investment is crucial to ensure they have what they need to keep #NOLA safe
26 new @NOPDNews officers have just taken their oath to uphold duty and personify courage as they serve the people of #NOLA. https://t.co/HPFqJuUWHa
The 22 members @NOLAFireDept Recruit Class R-2-17 has taken the oath to protect and save lives and property for the people of New Orleans. https://t.co/6AAPkyZDfF

I’m especially grateful to @NOLAFireDept Chief McConnell & @NOPDNews Chief Harrison. Because of their leadership, #NOLA has some of the finest public safety agencies in the country. https://t.co/6MkTAxERmc

This this joint recruit graduation between @NOPDNews & @NOLAFireDept is truly symbolic and a testament to the high levels of coordination between our public safety agencies. We are one team, one fight, one voice, one city! #NOLAProud https://t.co/A0HjFd6zVY

Delivering a professional, organized, coordinated and seamless transition of power is critical to accomplishing this important task.
We have given citizens of NOLA our very best the past 1,293 days and will do the same until I hand over the Office to Mayor-Elect Cantrell.
My administration is committed to finishing strong.
For several years, PFM has provided financial advisory services, budget support and management consulting to the City. They know our govt.
Additionally, the City engaged the PFM Group Consulting to coordinate the professional development of transition materials and support.
DM Morse will make sure we deliver on our promise to execute the most professional, detailed, and efficient transition process possible.
I have appointed Deputy Mayor Judy Reese Morse to oversee the transition for my administration.
In those early days, I personally vowed to ensure a professional transition for my successor.
In 2010, when we took office, my team and I inherited a City Hall that was dysfunctional.
The public expects there to be no break in the delivery and quality of services, and a peaceful and efficient transference of power.
Transitions are times of opportunity for local governments, if they are done right.
Congratulations to Mayor-Elect Cantrell. Saturday was a historic election. We elected our 1st female mayor.@LaToyaForNOLA https://t.co/ysdDd9Q412
It’s great to share with Mayor-Elect @LaToya_Cantrell today to discuss how we will work together on a robust & seamless transition. https://t.co/e89A239HsZ

column5: As part of the Citywide Public Safety Plan, we will also have 300 new police take-home cars hitting the streets over the next few months to help increase @NOPDNews visibility in neighborhoods and deter crime. https://t.co/AKCFKK7Ur1

Other features of the Real Time Crime Center include a briefing room fully equipped w video presentation technology, a training room and work stations for detectives. @NOPDNews @nolaready @NewOrleansEMS @NOLAFireDept https://t.co/fN7RWCFvOa
The $5 million+ Real Time Crime Center in #NOLA. features a 180 degree video monitoring wall to provide situational awareness at all times. https://t.co/CYZelsVFmP

@NOPDNews detectives will be able to utilize technology here at NOLA’s Real Time Crime Center that will significantly reduce time needed to review camera footage—allowing them to solve crimes faster. https://t.co/nfkCej4Hox

We have already installed 80 Crime cameras across #NOLA & 250 more are going up spring 2018. We are also inviting residents & businesses to connect public-facing security cameras to this Crime Center by visiting https://t.co/F4BGYQ7BWo. https://t.co/ooKR0oSB5V
The activation of this Real Time Crime Center represents a major milestone in the implementation of the $40M Citywide Public Safety Plan We announced in January. https://t.co/qF6X99zAWT

So proud to open this robust new Diabetes Center @NOEHospital. This will truly serve as a beacon of hope for those living with Diabetes. https://t.co/RpMJJYc6H4

This new diabetes center @NOEHospital is being dedicated to Rhesa & Alden McDonald and Sue Ellen & Joseph Cannizzaro. Thanks to their generosity, we can improve quality of life of those suffering w/ diabetes throughout the #NOLA region. https://t.co/LIKX5yCnDw

Today, we are doubling down on our promise to New Orleans East. Our new partnership with @usc_dori & the @ClevelandClinic allows nationally renowned experts in the field of diabetes to work side-by-side with other renowned researchers and specialists right here @NOEHospital

When I took office in 2010, I made a promise to the people of New Orleans East that we would restore quality healthcare to this area—and in 2014, we delivered on that promise, bringing state-of-the-art $130 million @NOEHospital into service.
I’m thrilled to be here on #NationalDiabetesDay for the grand opening and name dedication ceremony for the new @NOEHospital Diabetes Center https://t.co/QslIayrBdP

RT @StacyHeadNOLA: This is our most important accomplishment as a council and administration to show the the world: we have our fiscal hous…
This Rainy Day Savings Fund amendment is important for our future and to keep #NOLA moving in the right direction.
This measure will cement our major progress on maintaining fiscal health we have built together.
We don’t want put the next mayor and @NOLACityCouncil in the position that we were in early into our administration.
Since 2010, we have presented a balanced and fair budget. But, we have always lacked a source of funding in times of emergency.
Now our financial house is strong and bond ratings were upgraded to their highest levels ever.
When I took office 7.5+ years ago, we had to stop the City from falling off a financial cliff. We had to close a $97M budget deficit.
The Savings Fund would set aside portion of General Fund balance for fiscal emergencies to use when the City needs it.
Today, we’re reminding voters that the Rainy Day Savings Fund amendment to Home Rule Charter will be on Nov. 18 ballot. @NOLACityCouncil https://t.co/oX0JX3b85N
At 2 p.m.: Tune in to press conference on Rainy Day Savings Fund amendment that's on Nov. 18 ballot https://t.co/Xgi0jLzybm @NOLACityCouncil

column5: Making each neighborhood safe has been & will continue to be my top priority. This new Pay Plan helps us deliver on that promise even more.
We are rebuilding NOPD. We have tough, honest cops who risk their lives every day to ensure that we are safe.
NOPD Sgt. Kimera Woods: This new pay plan is a vote of confidence and support from the community we protect. https://t.co/XILPRk81Zt
.@NOPDNews: This is a restructuring of our department to reward officers with opportunities for growth. https://t.co/OPq3H0W8Gw
Our hard work is paying off: more officers on streets, response times are getting better, and 63% of residents feel safe.
.@NOLACityCouncil & I are committed to hiring and training a larger police force, launching or graduating 15 new recruit classes since 2010
We’re working every day to make NOLA safer by increasing investment in prevention, intervention and rehabilitation through @NOLA_FOR_LIFE
We are making sure people not only are safe, but they also feel safe.
This is another way we are ensuring our officers have tools they need to focus on reducing violent crime. @NOPDNews
This will increase pay across the board for all officers, allow officers to advance more quickly, & incentivize veteran officers to stay.
We feel an urgency to continue to make our streets safer. That’s why we’re doubling down on investments in our officers.
Today, Chief Harrison and I are implementing a new pay plan & job classification structure that'll help retain & grow police force @NOPDNews https://t.co/IaXt22k96G

column5: Again, please stay off of the road and shelter in place so that our first responders can be free to respond to life-threatening emergencies.
Flood Protection Authority: Entire hurricane risk reduction system is closed except for 1 valve. We are ready for this storm. https://t.co/i7a9UV6Th9
Please stay vigilant: this is going to be a wind event, could become a power outage event, and will also be a storm surge event.
.@EntergyNOLA: may take up to 7 days for restoration after storm. Teams will be responding until winds reach 30 mph. https://t.co/tGUNYaW6s9
@NewOrleansEMS: if you need to register for the Special Needs Registry or have questions about the registry, call 311. https://t.co/6HrCV11fbN
.@NOLAFireDept: please help us to keep you safe by hunkering down. https://t.co/3O7dEsta5u
.@NOPDNews : stay in if you can. Please don't drive through water. We will take swift action if citizens are doing that. https://t.co/WKkeK7fArv
.@NWSNewOrleans: Worst conditions expected between 7pm and 3am with hurricane force winds in eastern most parts of New Orleans https://t.co/wFQeJhPFL5
If you have special needs or are elderly please sign up at the special needs registry by calling 311.
. @NewOrleansRTA, Uber and Lyft will suspend transportation at 7 pm and residents and visitors should plan accordinly.
Due to expected heavy winds and the fast-moving nature of this storm, we would like visitors to be alert and plan ahead.
We are mindful that we have up to 40K visitors in town and a number of conferences planned that could change.
Homeless Outreach has been underway to transition people indoors and out of harms way.
. @nolahealthdept has been working with our Homeless Service Providers today and homeless shelters are open.
Persons traveling for legitimate reasons such as work will be allowed to do so. But please stay off the roads if you can.
Given this, I instituted a Mandatory Curfew that will begin today at 7 p.m. and end tom. at 7 a.m.
. @NWSNewOrleans: majority of serious impact and storm surge will likely occur in the evening and overnight.
There could be 7 to 11 ft of storm surge near Rigolets, Irish Bayou & Lake Catherine and 3 to 5 ft of storm surge around Lake Pontchatrain.
. @NWSNewOrleans has warned of potential life-threatening inundation from storm surge this evening and tonight.
NOFD Engine 31 remains fully staffed to respond to life-threatening reports in Venetian Isles.
Residents should wrap up any activities and shelter in place as soon as possible.
A Cat. 2 hurricane can produce winds as strong as 100 mph so this should be taken very seriously.
We are now feeling the early impacts of #Nate. Slight adjustments can cause more serious impact so we must remain vigilant.
Storm is moving very fast. Eye is expected to make landfall around 8 pm as Cat. 2 hurricane.
I just received my 5th briefing from @NWSNewOrleans on development of #Nate. https://t.co/VFnUZeWkuZ
RT @NASA_SPoRT: #Nate is a Cat. 1 hurricane w/ sust. winds of 90 MPH. @NHC_Atlantic expects landfall tonight as a Cat. 2 w/ 105 MPH winds.…
RT @NWSNewOrleans: The first outer band of Hurricane #Nate is approaching the New Orleans metro. Conditions will deteriorate quickly this a…
RT @NWSNewOrleans: Areas within the storm surge warning along the coast are not safe! Storm surge will be a life threatening hazard tonight…
Ran into @paulwrainwater and SWB Crew Member working at Drainage Pump State 7 https://t.co/vp0g4m8lL2

column5: I encourage everyone to stay off streets starting tom. at 6 and until we are clear on Sunday, so we can keep you safe.
.@nationalguardLA: We have 15 personnel assisting with S&WB team. We are with you and will help you protect what matters. https://t.co/KrDUa2P8lP
.@EntergyNOLA: we have Inspected lines serving S&WB and are constantly communicating with their team. https://t.co/kTIIaaeM4c
.@NewOrleansEMS: again, please be safe if you're operating a generator. Carbon monoxide is an odorless, colorless gas. https://t.co/5l3v5Ujfgm
.@NO_Airport is executing emergency plan and want to highlight that parking in airport garages will be restricted to ticketed customers only
We are strongly urging residents to secure outdoor furniture, loose debris, & garbage cans which can turn into projectiles during high wind
If you have special needs or are elderly please sign up for special needs registry by calling 311.
Residents should stock up on supplies, be ready to move cars to neutral grounds and high ground if necessary.
As we shared yesterday, none of our preparations will matter if citizens do not do their part.
There are newly installed large placards on underpasses to warn drivers of deep water & to urge people to not drive when there is heavy rain
Citizens should prepare for some street flooding especially underneath underpasses.
We are in a stronger place w/ power and pumps. But, if #Nate produces large amount of rainfall, we could see some localized flooding.
The S&WB and contractors are working 24/7 to repair all power and pumps. 109 of 120 pumps are working, and we’re at 92% capacity.
. @nolahealthdept is coordinating support for those in nursing homes and with special needs.
DPW and contractors are continuing to clean and repair catch basins. We have 14 trucks and crews on the street right now.
. @NOLAFireDept will continue distributing free sandbags from 5 fire stations across the city.
Our Emergency Operation Center has been activated. All depts. and agencies continue to execute their emergency plans.
I am instituting a Mandatory Curfew that will begin Saturday at 6 p.m. and ending Sunday morning.
.@NWSNewOrleans has cautioned that majority of serious impact and storm surge will likely occur overnight.
Because nearby floodgates will be closing, residents must evacuate the area by noon Saturday.
Areas outside of levee protection could see 6-9 ft surge.I'm ordering Mandatory Evacuation for Venetian Isles, Lake Catherine & Irish Bayou
We are particularly mindful of vulnerabilities in Venetian Isles, Lake Catherine, and Irish Bayou.
When winds hit 30-40 mph we stop RTA busses, flights at the airport, and NOPD/NOFD responses until the winds slow.
We can see serious tropical storm forced winds between 30 and 80 mph starting Saturday.
Models will likely change. Current forecast indicates 3-6 in. of rain over duration of #Nate. Great chance of strong winds and storm surge.
While still uncertain, latest forecast shows #Nate producing heavy winds and above-average rainfall in area beginning Sat afternoon thru Sun
#Nate is expected to move into Gulf tonight, form into a hurricane and potentially approach LA coast by tom. evening.
According to @NWSNewOrleans #Nate has shifted slightly eastward and Hurricane Watch is upgraded to Hurricane Warning. https://t.co/qCvnlJnt9s
#NOLAFireDept assisting residents w/ free sandbags for TS #Nate. Available 24/7 until further notice. https://t.co/7act8El38U
@harrisonjaime @CedricRichmond @TeamKCP @JohnBelforLA @LaDemos @StephenHandwerk @DNC We can't wait to have you in NOLA!
#NOLAFireDept is getting ready to help you prepare for TS #Nate! Sandbags will be available for pickup 24/7 starting tomorrow. https://t.co/EVVnNCKtAi
RT @nolaready: In preparation for TS #Nate, free sandbags are available 24/7, starting tom. at 7 a.m. until further notice at select @NOLAF…
If we stay informed, alert and prepared, we will ultimately stay safe. To receive @NOLAReady alerts, visit https://t.co/kQrdgO8iwd.
.@EntergyNOLA: If you're going to shelter in place, prepare for outages lasting up to 7 days. https://t.co/fImtlRxoih
In the event of street flooding, do not drive through flooded roadways, pushing water into businesses and homes of your neighbors.
.@NOPDNews: We are strongly urging not to drive underneath underpasses that we all know are prone to flooding during heavy rain events. https://t.co/SrKGGBb3sC
.@RunWithJason: We still are not where we want to be with pumps and drainage, but we are much better than where we were. https://t.co/FXa2og1a8U
There is no need to panic. Be ready and prepare. Get a plan. Prepare to protect your personal property.
This type of coordination is standard for emergency teams during hurricane season and we will continue to update the public.
Our first responders will be all hands on deck. They are staging high water vehicles, boats and barricades in strategic locations right now.
DPW and contractors are continuing to aggressively clean and repair catch basins.  We have 14 trucks and crews on the street right now.
The S&WB and contractors are working 24/7 to repair all power and pumps. Today, 108 of 120 pumps are working, and we’re at 92% capacity.
Sewerage and Water Board are conducting drills to ensure we are ready in the event of intense rain.
All depts. and agencies have begun executing emergency plans to ensure we are leaning forward & are best prepared for whatever comes our way https://t.co/G2YP8iHOaX
I've been communicating w/ @LouisianaGov to ensure we were coordinated with the state. Thank you for leaning forward, @LouisianaGov.
As we do in all emergency events, we have been in communication w/ local, federal and state partners.
Strong wind can cause significant power outages. We are working w/@EntergyNOLA and encourage citizens to have back up supplies.
Models will likely change as #Nate moves closer. Small deviations could lead to significant changes in impact for #NOLA.
Given these threats, I have declared a State of Emergency for #NOLA.
.@NWSNewOrleans is expecting #Nate to move into Gulf by tomorrow and potentially approach LA coast Sunday morning as a hurricane.
Happening now: @MayorLandrieu and City officials give update on TS #Nate preparations https://t.co/Xgi0jLzybm
As we prepare for TS #Nate, we have 14 trucks and crews out cleaning catch basins. https://t.co/zysL2r3FUG

Together, we are creating real pathways for real people. @Living_Cities #TIILearn
This is what happens when public, private, philanthropic & not-for-profit communities work together. @Living_Cities #TIILearn
We are about bringing people together, seeing each other for our humanity. Every program we've created has been designed to do just that.
Monuments were about a mindset. Exclusion may have driven people who would have been great citizens elsewhere. @Living_Cities #TiiLearn
Grateful to have @Living_Cities in NOLA again #TIILearn https://t.co/4OOIRr2wiW
Our team has tried to find a way or make one. @Living_Cities #TIILearn https://t.co/N9fjEqDF5D
Instead of doing the thing we were dying to do, we decided we were going to build the city back the way it should have been. @Living_Cities
We are at our best when we are lifting each other up. The essential truth that we learned during Katrina is we are all in the same boat.
We are thankful for @Living_Cities investment: millions of dollars for entrepreneurs, low-income healthcare and BuildNOLA Mobilization Fund.
That's how we were when Katrina hit us. It ripped away our sense of security. We had to rebuild. #TIILearn @Living_Cities
Right now everyone in harm's way is thinking about how to get back to their way of life. @Living_Cities #TIILearn
