RT @nolaready: #NOLAReady alert: Flood Advisory in effect for #NOLA until 8:30 p.m. tonight. Call 911 to report flooding.
DPW is working hard to clear catch basins around #NOLA. Take a look at these pics showing before, during & after a catch basin cleaning. https://t.co/kv0zrmMCPI
I want to remind #NOLA that we are not yet in the clear. We may see heaviest rain tonight and tom. Remain vigilant and cautious. #NOLAready
RT @nolaready: #NOLAReady alert: Areal Flood Advisory in effect for #NOLA until 8:30 p.m. today.
RT @nolaready: #NOLAReady alert: Strong tstorm expected to move through #NOLA shortly.
S&WB will continue to work 24/7 to return turbines 3 and 4 to service, continuing testing until the turbines are ready to generate power.
Yesterday, we reported Pump C at S&WB Drainage Pumping Station 6 was out. It was returned to service today.
If you have special needs or care for someone who does, sign up for Special Needs Registry. Call 311 or visit https://t.co/igBjmdcAGd.
Please continue to stay off the streets if flash flooding occurs.
Schools and public buildings will resume normal schedules tomorrow. We will update you if that changes due to overnight activity.
The @NWSNewOrleans continues to predict heavy rain, thunderstorms and flash flooding, with heaviest rain likely tonight.
At the start, @NWSNewOrleans predicted 5-10 in. To date, we have received 3-4 in. of rain. We have more days to go so this is on track.
#NOLA is resilient. We will weather this storm too. And we know our friends in Texas and SW Louisiana will as well.
Our first responders have begun to identify search and rescue teams that can mobilize in Texas when the time comes.
I reactivated NOLA Pay It Forward Fund yesterday to help our neighbors in Texas and Southwest LA. Visit https://t.co/WAU4PsNDqs to donate
Now we watch our friends in a Houston experience a similar hardship. We will not forget the compassion they showed us in our time of need.
12 years ago, Katrina changed us forever. Entire neighborhoods, families torn apart.
RT @nolaready: #NOLAReady alert: Strong storm moving through area. Potential of winds over 30 MPH with this storm.
We have reactivated the NOLA Pay It Forward Fund to support those affected by #Harvey. To donate, visit https://t.co/WAU4PsNDqs. https://t.co/fom0PRfWNX

By tom., we will issue an RFP for independent third-party to do after action analysis.
Visit https://t.co/yloYic7Vuv to see in real-time where traffic accidents and street flooding are occurring based on 911 calls.
We have a plan to fix power supply, pumps, catch basins and drain lines. We will get system running in better shape over next few wks.
On issue of S&WB manpower: it is now clear that there were staffing issues and not all pumping stations were manned last week.
Until these generators are set up and we have turbines come online – which could be few wks.—we have some risk to our drainage capacity.
Generators will be used to provide power to the central plant and at individual pump stations.
We are working to move funds to clean and fix more catch basins and drain lines.
I accept it. I own it. And I am taking the responsibility to fix it.
These vulnerabilities are unacceptable, especially in the height of hurricane season. I won’t rest until we get where we need to be safe.
It has become clear: we have major issues of SWB power, pumps and manpower, and DPW catch basins and minor drain lines.
It's now clear:  system has never been 100% operational or at 100% of its capacity. I can't make good decisions unless I have info I trust.

I will continue to give you everything I have for the next 280 days so that our next mayor and Council are best positioned. #2018NolaBudget
Let’s continue to move our city forward and continue to improve on the foundation we have built.  #2018NolaBudget
We are America’s best comeback story. #2018NolaBudget
We jump-started a stalled recovery & really got cranes in the sky.  We also welcomed major philanthropic investments to leverage our work.
We cannot return to the days where businesses feel they need to pay to play.
There must be fiscal responsibility, predictability and absolutely no corruption.
I want deliver a message to New Orleanians on the need for a strong continued, principled and fiscal leadership from Mayor & City Council...
We will continue our allocation of nearly $20 million in new or rollover funding for affordable housing. #2018NolaBudget
We're including operational funding to support costs of the newly transferred former VA Hospital complex for our low barrier shelter.
That’s 8x the normal amount—giving the next Mayor and City Council time to find funding for the rest of the work that needs to be done.
We will spend $400M every year for the next five years to continue to fix streets, sewers and drains...
We have fixed 133 miles of streets. Filled 400,884 potholes. That’s more by far than any previous administration in our history.
We revamped @NORDCommission by nearly tripling funding and we’re investing over $150M to rebuild community centers, pools and playgrounds.
We’re increasing funding for the Mayor’s Office to support Youth Force NOLA and proposing institutionalizing our workforce training work.
In 2018, we are proposing a third pay raise for NOPD through a new pay plan that will boost recruitment and retention of officers.
Public satisfaction with @NOPDNews is way up: from 33% in 2009 to 64%, which is an all-time high. Morale inside NOPD is up too.
Since 2010, funding for @NOPDNews is up by over $30M per year, which is about a 25% increase. #2018NolaBudget
This year our proposed operating budget is $647 million and our proposed capital budget is $691 million. #2018NolaBudget
In order to make sure we left no stone unturned, we conducted telephone town halls to ensure alignment – engaging over 3000 citizens.
2018 budget largely maintains priorities from 2017. We’re proposing it earlier to ensure smooth transition to next admin. #2018NolaBudget
In summation, we rebuilt a broken city.  We established strong ethics and fiscal responsibility. #2018NolaBudget https://t.co/LRWwCxwQKl
We increased DBE Investments and Performance. We revamped workforce development efforts and we also added the One Stop shop for permitting.
Together, we also increased revenue by adding Revenue Staff to go after unpaid tax collection. #2018NolaBudget
In seven years, we have righted the ship of government, going from a budget deficit to a budget surplus. #2018NolaBudget
Our budget approach has been pretty simple – 1)cut smart, 2) reorganize, 3) invest and 4)grow. #2018NolaBudget
Together, we brought sound fiscal Mgmt., balanced budgets & ethical contracting to City Hall, leading to City’s highest-ever credit rating.
We had to close a $97M budget deficit that threatened to put our city into bankruptcy.
Seven years ago we came into office in the midst of the BP Oil Spill only to find an equally severe financial crisis of our own.
Together, we are laying a stronger foundation for the future. #2018NolaBudget
Excited to join my team and introduce our final budget to the @NOLACityCouncil https://t.co/x6sybN8xaq

Best ways to help with crime: hire youth during summer and mentor youth. #nolabudgettalk @NOPDNews
On lead: SWB highest priority to make sure your drinking water is safe. There is currently no health risk. Our water is safe #nolabudgettalk

Thank you @Anne_Hidalgo & @MikeBloomberg for #cities4climate leadership and inspiring #Nola to act. @Mayors4Climate https://t.co/0pq6tofsNG

This strategy will reduce our City's greenhouse gas emissions 50% by 2030! #climatemayors #cities4climate
Excited to announce Climate Action for a Resilient New Orleans! Our City's first Climate Action Strategy!! https://t.co/SHCqjprXBH
Today I gave my 7th and final State of the City address. View full text here: https://t.co/apzXhVOrSd #foundationforfuture #nolaprogress
Always remember: together, we are the ones who rebuilt this city and came back strong when no one thought we could. #foundationforfuture
Nearly $8B of new investments. Record number of visitors. Record tonnage at port. Record public investment. Record high property values.
After 7 yrs of hard work, we are reaping benefits of some of foundational changes we’ve made. Our challenge: continue our progress.
If #NOLA wants more police, we need our best, bravest to apply: https://t.co/axWXjNAETx . Respond to the call for duty. Your city needs you.
Yesterday, I announced a new proposal to give another across-the-board pay bump to @NOPDNews officers #nolasotc
Now @nopdnews is better paid, trained, managed, & equipped w/ take home car for officers by end of year, increasing overnight visibility.
In June @NOPDNews made 125 arrests for serious crimes from human trafficking to murder w/ help of community.
No amount of officers, guns or prisons can solve deeper problem. The system needs to change – social and economic. #foundationforfuture
I understand long-term gains aren’t enough for you and they aren’t enough for me. I understand the impatience given surge of violent crime.
Criminal justice reform is now bipartisan national movement and it is about reorienting the system to focus on violent crime.
Criminal justice system disproportionately impacts people of color and the poor. It is too big, too broken, and incentivizes incarceration.
We created the Economic Opportunity Strategy and now the number of working age African American men working is up 8 points.
B/c of our @nola_for_life Multi-Agency Gang Unit we have gotten 134 indictments from 15 different violent gangs and groups #nolaprogress
As a part of that, @ceasefirenola has focused on interrupting violence by mediating neighborhood beefs that threaten to turn violent.
. @NOLA_FOR_LIFE has helped over 32K New Orleanians get assistance, whether it is finding a job or returning home after prison.
That’s why in 2012, we launched @NOLA_FOR_LIFE focused not just on intervention, but on prevention and interrupting the cycle of violence. https://t.co/AqnUbpXTch
.  @NOPDnews alone cannot solve crime particularly shootings and murder. We need to think holistically and get at root of these crimes.
Technology is helping @NOPDNews : crime cameras, license plate readers, enhanced lighting to stop crime before it happens.
It’s been hard work, we’re seeing results. Public satisfaction w/ @NOPDnews is up from 33% in 2009 to 64%, which is an all-time high.
W/ 15% pay raises and more aggressive recruitment, by 2018 we will have graduated 14 @nopdnews recruit classes, nearly 400 new officers
We were one of the first in the nation to adopt body worn cameras. The facts are there for everyone to see. @nopdnews #nolaprogress
. @NOPDNews has undergone major reforms, reduced corruption and improved police-community relationships in local neighborhoods.
As we reformed @NOPDNews we have invested. Since 2010, funding for NOPD is up by $30M+ per year.
The most immediate and urgent issue we face is violent crime. There is no more important issue for us to rally around as a city.
Tomorrow, I will outline how City plans to take on climate change with our own unique Climate Action Strategy @resilientNOLA
W/ our fed. govt. pulling out of the Paris agreement, cities are leading climate change effort. No other city has more at stake
To be strong in an uncertain world, we need to be all in. Our strength is in our unity, diversity & culture #foundationforfuture https://t.co/TySZc4gKgM
By 2018, b/c we’ve had relentless focus on affordable housing, 7800+ homes will have been completed #nolaprogress https://t.co/gZ5VAjzNvO
Turned around @NORDcommission, tripled funding to expand rec programs, & rebuild playgrounds & libraries https://t.co/KZMHKTPe7j
In 7 yrs, City’s budget deficit has turned into surplus. #nola credit rating is highest in City history #foundationforfuture #nolaprogress
675 new DBEs have been certified to get millions of dollars in city work. STRIVE, S&WB and @delgadocc have trained hundreds of residents.
In 8 yrs: $900M+ invested in NO East and $675M in Lower Nine – totaling in over $1.5B #nolaprogress
7 yrs ago, I gave my 1st #NOLASOTC address. Message was that we inherited a mess of epic proportions and needed to change course.
When it seemed like all was lost, people of #NOLA stepped up and demanded unity, action, reform, results #oneteam
. @umcno, the VA and NO East Hospital have opened in past few years, and now there is a biomedical corridor in heart of #NOLA
. @GS10KSmallBiz, which we brought here, has helped 500+ small business owners, supporting 8,000+ jobs across the region
After decades of starts and stops, your new $1B @no_airport is coming out of the ground as we speak. #foundationforfuture  #nolaprogress
7 yrs ago, $97M deficit, recovery was stalled, led nation in blight, cloud of corruption, and BP oil spill. #nolasotc
Homelessness is down by 80%. Became 1st US city to eliminate homelessness among Veterans. We’re building new shelter at old VA hospital.
New #NOLA way is all in, everybody together. Fed., state & local govt. at the table w/ private sector, non-profits & faith based orgs.
In 7 yrs, retail sector is booming w/ 140+ new retail businesses, also growing jobs #foundationforfuture #nolaprogress
We’ve fixed more streets in 7 yrs. than any previous administration, over 133 miles completed and $500M invested. #nolasotc
Our goal: to grow in an equitable way. Want people of #NOLA to be ones to rebuild #NOLA. We’ll bring equity lens to budgeting process
#nola is a coastal city, surrounded by water. Our land is sinking, our coast eroding. #nolasotc
In 2018, the next mayor will take over a much more prepared and prosperous city than what we inherited in 2010. #foundationforfuture
#NOLA has seen amazing progress over the past 7 yrs. We’ve laid the foundation for a better, brighter tomorrow. https://t.co/ORVAQ2cDG1 https://t.co/BXlDoURPKT
B/c of our work w/ DBEs, Otis Tucker grew his business and was able to be more competitive in his field https://t.co/RGiKDAMFeC #nolasotc https://t.co/bLBLPqoAue
Tonight I give my final #nolasotc address as your mayor. Use #NOLAsotc when posting. https://t.co/fZ8lCirYfE
Thank you Building & Land Technology, @SalamanderHotel @NopsiHotel for restoring this beautiful building & adding over 300 new jobs to #NOLA https://t.co/myei0nuoBK
After standing blighted for over 30 years, I'm glad to see @NopsiHotel come back to commerce in the CBD

Troy Delaune got a job w/ @ceasefirenola helping stop violence before it starts. https://t.co/Cuqm4LxDQ2 #nolasotc
"The men and women of @NOPDNews are on the front line every day. They are the best of New Orleans." -@JaredCBrossett https://t.co/e5zxPQ8nVt
"Making this investment in @NOPDNews is part of a larger plan to make #NOLA safer & we do this without hesitation." -@CouncilmanGray https://t.co/YMfsmeqUdS
"We're putting our resources where they are needed most and that's with our police officers." - @susanguidry https://t.co/qh7c6bAREp
This new investment in the NOPD, along with more aggressive and proactive policing is designed to help retain officers and stem the uptick. https://t.co/V1K4OEBYrU
In New Orleans, we feel the urgency – that’s why we’re doubling down on our investments in our officers.
Despite our best efforts and recent periods of progress, today no one is happy where we are.
Over the last 20 years, NOLA has lost 4,000 people to murder. Today, murder and violent crime rates are down 60% compared to peak in 90’s.
Since 2010, we have launched or graduated 13 new recruit classes and hired over 300 @NOPDNews police officers.
We have tough, honest cops who risk their lives every day to ensure that we are safe.
And close to 200 more citizens have accessed our re-entry program @NOLA_FOR_LIFE RISE.
The @NOPDNews -led MAG Unit worked with local, state and federal partners to indict 134 of most violent group and gang members.
.@NOPDNews budget is up 25% and we have spent $2.25B on public safety and preparedness.
Public safety continues to be my top priority, that is why we continue to hire and train a larger, more professional police force;
Today I am happy to unveil a new pay plan and job classification structure to increase pay for all officers. https://t.co/JBeqWC8nZx

Mayors from cities and towns across America are leading with an Agenda for the Future. Read our plan here: https://t.co/8iBLL5kkf9 @usmayors
Mayors: It is our time. Let’s seize the moment. And let’s get back to work. @usmayors #uscm2017
We will prove that we are a force to be reckoned with on behalf of the American people.
It’s our country’s mayors’ time to lead, and we will do it. When we speak with one voice, we can break through the noise and the chaos.
Many have praised speech I gave on Confederate monuments. I have learned: in time of great turmoil, a mayor talked, and the nation listened.
Pres. Kennedy told mayors in 1963: “You can set an example in your communities to which the timid can rally.”
We should not wait until the next catastrophe to bring our country together. Let’s do it now. We can and we must.
I saw in that moment: when the entire civil govt. disappeared. When people had a common enemy, threat or opportunity, there was unity.
I’ve seen people come together at highest & lowest. When everybody needs to be pulled out of water, nobody worries about what boat to get in
Mayors: bring your leaders from Washington to the streets of America. Carry voices of your people to Washington to better people’s lives.
The things which unite us in our shared humanity make us stronger than anything that divides us.
Mayors have led this nation forward for generations. This is the legacy we inherit. Today, we stand at another moment.
At every defining moment in our country, it has been Mayors stepping into the breach to help American families.
I watched my father Moon, Dutch Morial, & his son after him @MarcMorial. All 3 led this org. and set an example for me.
I am lucky enough to be the 5th Mayor of #NOLA to serve as pres. of this organization @usmayors – and 2nd one named Landrieu.
…but instead will emerge from the Main Streets and byways of this great country.
The solutions to this country’s problems won’t come from the halls of Congress or the boardrooms on Wall Street…
In our country, we are too often paralyzed by division or overcome by indifference. We fight over a little meat on an otherwise empty bone.
If we are united, we are strong. This is where I want us to start.
Dr. King said: all tied together in “single garment of destiny.” @BillClinton told us we have to stitch it back together when it gets ripped
The true genius of America: it is ‘we the people,’ ‘indivisible’ with ‘liberty and justice for all’ -- not just some.
Mayors know America is not and has never been survival of the fittest. That is not when we are at our best. But that is where we are now.
We cannot simply resist and retreat – we must lead and engage.
When we work across party, we find common ground and neighbors who share dream of better future that we are working for.
Mayors must fight to put the people we represent over politics. We need to speak w/ one voice; w/ courage, conviction and honesty.
We can help Washington find fixes necessary to protect the over 20M who may lose health care if they keep going in this direction.
Next wk, Senate will vote on healthcare bill that'll cause more confusion & anxiety. Less coverage means more burden on cities and hospitals
Our job is to deliver for our people to put a face with public policy we create.
As I enter final yr of 2nd term as Mayor & 30th yr of public service, I cherish opportunity to seek solutions. Compromise is not dirty word.
This is about improving lives of all Americans. None of us will truly live up to our potential unless we all have the same opportunity.
We laid out positive, bipartisan, national vision, our Mayors’ Agenda for the Future. Showing Washington what kind of partner we hope for.
Mayors are rebuilding American infrastructure, combating climate change, and connecting people to jobs & opportunity through education.
Mayors can show America what leadership looks like. The country is clearly hungry for results and that’s what a Mayor delivers every day.
RT @usmayors: American greatness is alive and well in cities & towns across the country - from urban to rural to suburban, from coast to co…

column5: Testament to innovative work we're doing. Thank you @NOLAFireDept and our Performance & Accountability team @ojwise https://t.co/6DKkTYvXJF
If you don’t spend your political capital then why do you serve? #captalksrace
We have to ask ourselves through an equity lens: do all of us have pathways to prosperity? #captalksrace
We have to know issues of race and class are there. If we can get past that, opens up opportunity to solve other problems #captalksrace
In order to represent people, you need to listen to everybody, including the people who don’t necessarily agree with you. #captalksrace
Of all the hard things we’ve addressed in this city, race is the hardest one. It's a real deep divide #captalksrace
Every other mayor has tried to do this before me. I was fortunate to get it done. #CAPtalksrace https://t.co/DFiUCVSRDq
We’re an exceptional country because of who we are & what we believe. We need to match this w/ exceptional words & deeds #captalksrace
We saw this during Katrina: When everybody needed to be saved, nobody worried about what boat they were in. #captalksrace
Walking through race is hard, painful, uncomfortable. When we come out on the other side, we’re all going to be better for it. @captalksrace
If there was coalition of disenfranchised people across this country, all groups would get what they want, what they deserve. #captalksrace
But when the victim is a young child or a white college student or a professional athlete everything stops for a minute. #captalksrace
Over 80% of victims of violence are African American young men, too often forsaken or left behind. #captalksrace
When people aren’t given what is justly theirs or have access to things they need you can’t have peace, only alienation. #captalksrace
Race lies at the root of so many problems but we never fully reckon with it until there is a flare up #captalksrace @amprog
Changing symbols is the beginnings. We need to change attitudes to finally address violence, poverty, jobs and many more. #captalksrace
RT @amprog: "Centuries old wounds are still raw because they never healed right in the first place" - @MayorLandrieu #CAPTalksRace
Addressing race in America with @amprog https://t.co/IY7y7TPpsA
RT @amprog: .@MayorLandrieu speaks at CAP at 10am - you won't want to miss this https://t.co/ILiNWG9sbU #CAPTalksRace

column5: It is down. Now New Orleans starts a new chapter in our history. https://t.co/UHf6qRt9a3
Glad to be joined by so many people standing for real and right change. NOLA is moving forward. https://t.co/J8BJAhEt2q
Another historic moment in #NOLA embracing justice and compassion. Let’s stand together and redefine our future
Now is the time to come together and heal and focus on our larger task - creating the New Orleans of our dreams. https://t.co/G63r2veJfh
We've not erased history; we're righting the wrong image these monuments represent & crafting a better future for all our children.
If we take these statues down and don’t change to become a more open and inclusive society this would have all been in vain.
We justify our silence and inaction by manufacturing noble causes that marinate in historical denial.
To put the confederacy on a pedestal in our most prominent places of honor is a bad prescription for our future.
So we can connect with integrity to the founding principles of our nation & forge a straighter path toward a better and more perfect union.
I want to gently peel from your hands the grip on a false narrative of our history that I think weakens us and make straight a wrong… https://t.co/vGSOM34sbN
I want to speak about why we chose to remove these monuments to the Lost Cause of the Confederacy, and how this process can lead to healing.
Watch live: Special address on removal of monuments that prominently celebrate the Lost Cause of the Confederacy https://t.co/BwLLg2eUyx
Today we complete the removal of the four Confederate statues which celebrated the Cult of the Lost Cause by removing Robert E. Lee statue.
Proud to be recognized by @kaboom as a 2017 #PlayfulCityUSA. Providing safe, fun opportunities for our youth is our  top priority in #NOLA. https://t.co/nxhDaWC92l
Follow @nolaready and sign up today  at https://t.co/igBjmdcAGd for year-round public safety and preparedness tips and updates
Over the last 12 years, we have learned & developed best practices for how to prepare for hurricanes and evacuations @nolaready
Today hundreds of volunteers, and local, state & federal partners are practicing our City-Assisted Evacuation system https://t.co/pu2jMNb5UN
The third confederate statue is now down. Another step forward for our city. https://t.co/MxIgs1NTrD
It is through acts of courage and standing for what is right that we will build the city of our dreams. https://t.co/wduBaUDp5e
Today we refuse to allow our past to define us and begin removal of the Beauregard statue honoring the Confederacy. https://t.co/i0b2qeAaCq
A construction crew breaks up the existing asphalt pavement on Canal St. to connect the new Bourbon St. drainage line to the City’s system. https://t.co/ptf01qaOA1
Thank you for answering the call to serve. Our city is better and safer because of your commitment. #nationalpoliceweek2017 https://t.co/898qTiTWMO
Congratulations @delgadocc 2017 graduates!
Crews continue work on 2nd phase of St. Charles repaving project. This phase is scheduled to be complete by late spring @roadworknola https://t.co/GUKqnVq04b
There’s nothing like a mother’s love. Happy Mother’s Day to all the mothers out there. https://t.co/utPPrNuAV0
Congratulations to all of those graduating today in #NOLA @du1869 @XULA1925 @SUNOKnights @UofNO @Loyola_NOLA
Crews excavate sections of roadway in the 200 block of Bourbon St. to identify utilities that may have settled over time @roadworknola https://t.co/7VWc2Na0aF
The $44M Homewood Suites  French Quarter Hotel is another advancement in the ongoing Bienville Basin Choice Neighborhoods revitalization.

RT @BGRNola: Thanks to @IBERIABANK for sponsoring today's @BGRNola #BreakfastBriefing, featuring @MayorLandrieu moderated by @LeeZurik. htt…
RT @nolaready: We are now seeing severe T storms moving through the #NOLA area. Please be careful on the road and don't drive thru standing…
It was great to share with you today BGR. Thanks for the partnership addressing tough issues and moving NOLA forward. https://t.co/6lSytjK4YH
@BGRBreakfastBriefing: I have enjoyed every second serving as your mayor. I commit to giving NOLA everything I have for the next 403 days.
The WAY we have made so much progress is by focusing on building the city not as she was, but as we wanted her to be.
The WAY we have made so much progress is by partnership with the govt, business, faith based community, and non-profits pulling together.
The WAY we have made so much progress is by selecting honest people who want to do the right thing for the right reason.
We haven't done this on our own. The best thing about our administration is what I call - the "new New Orleans Way."
We reformed the Firefighters Pension Fund to put this city on a sound fiscal footing for the future.
We inherited huge legacy costs that strangled the ability of the mayor and city council.

We reduced blight by 15,000 units.
Graduation rates are up. Dropout rates are down and the achievement gap is closing rapidly for our kids.
None of this could have been possible without the @NOLACityCouncil. We have had unprecedented partnership. Thank you.
@BGRBreakfastBriefing: We have delivered 7 years of balanced budgets and the highest credit rating in NOLA's history.
@BGRBreakfastBriefing: In a few months, the next mayor and City Council will take over a stronger government and ascending city! https://t.co/orR2qBZEae
The mandate I gave to my team was to do the hard things so the next team could soar.
Our website was even a joke. It was the https://t.co/WOQxPJMKFn. We didn't want to be the City of NO.
When I came into office many departments had overspent their budgets and we were close to the brink of bankruptcy.
When I came into office, government was a wreck, the Feds were about to take over our police and City Hall was open only 4 days a week.
It's great to be at the BGR Breakfast Briefingn to give an update on our great city and my outlook for the future.

@NolaGirlJade : 
We have to ensure that everyone we invite to the table is coming because their perspectives are unique.
@UnitedWaySELA : Nearly 50% of families in NOLA struggle to make ends meet & survive. That's a clear indication: we have an equity problem.

Deputy Mayor Morse: 
Leadership & intention are key to #equityneworleans. You need a very clear strategy that focuses on impact & outcomes.
This year, we will release city’s first-ever Equity Strategy to impact development of future strategies & decision-making w/in city govt.
. @policylink: Equity says get it right for everybody. Make a society in which all can prosper and reach their fullest potential.
. @WK_Kellogg_Fdn : This is not a "their" problem. This is an "us" problem. We all have to own the problem and the solution.
. @nopdnews 5th dist. Cmdr. Young: Most innovative thing I've heard was Mayor making violence reduction his priority https://t.co/0y1oPL3ZI7
. @BridgesFundMgmt: Be clear about what problem you are solving and explain it to people. This "better together" thing really works.
. @iseechange: Always think that you belong at the table. Turn what people might think of as your disadvantages into your advantages.
RT @GNOHA: 'Public safety, equity, resilience... New Orleans you are worthy' @MayorLandrieu @helloNOEW
RT @IdeaVillage: .@MayorLandrieu opens up the Civic Innovation Summit at #NOEW2017 https://t.co/ksXyLg4jtE

RT @UnitedWaySELA: @MayorLandrieu: "A city that goes forward together...with everyone lifting each other up...is a city that succeeds." 
#N…
All of the progress we've made continues to be threatened until we all move forward together.
#NOLA is the definition of a resilient city. Catastrophic events provide an opportunity – out of necessity – to transform a community.
Last year, we launched #EquityNewOrleans to assess the role of equity in city government.
We launched our Economic Opportunity Strategy to create pathways to prosperity and better opportunities for disadvantaged job seekers.
In 2014, we launched the Welcome Table New Orleans Initiative to focus specifically on race, reconciliation and community building.
We are addressing the issues we face. We can argue about whose fault it is. We can't argue about whose responsibility it is to fix it.
Our experts will lead a conversation around three pressing challenges facing our city: violence reduction, equity and resilience.
We created Civic Innovation Summit to accelerate the City’s momentum by creating a conversation around topics important to NOLA.
Welcome to the Civic Innovation Summit @hellonoew #NOEW2017 https://t.co/jCBGCumGDg

. @naehomelessness: #nola is to be congratulated for taking this important step to end homelessness – for homeless people, City & nation.
. @covenanthouse: Adult members of our community who find themselves homeless will be true beneficiaries of this public/private partnership.
. @cathcharitiesNO: We have spent years talking about low barrier shelter & are excited that the time has come to make this happen.
. @nadineramsey: This concept incorporates best practices and has been extremely vetted at all levels of government and in the community.
. @LaToya_Cantrell: The site has the capacity to offer assistance to people while beginning to confront 2 root causes of homelessness.
. @susanguidry: Co-location of services gives vulnerable people in our community resources they need to become healthy & productive again.
. @runwithjason: By connecting those in need of stable housing to it, we will better assist one of our most vulnerable populations.
. @lahousingcorp: Housing is solution to ending homelessness. Adding shelter beds will provide a path to housing for our most vulnerable.
. @unitygno: Low barrier shelter approach will most effectively reduce unsheltered homelessness and make our community better for everyone.
. @DeptVetAffairs: This will not only assist in maintaining functional 0 for Veteran homelessness, also help to reduce homelessness for all.
. @DDDNewOrleans: Expansion of shelter beds is about creating front door to system of care to provide homeless w/ services to stay housed. https://t.co/PkUBVMc5jD

column5: RT @nolaready: ALERT: Due to a traffic related incident, please avoid the intersection of Orleans Ave. and North Carrollton Ave.
Due to heavy congestion, vehicular traffic Downtown and in the French Quarter is advised to use caution and stay away unless necessary.
The City is again reminding citizens to not bring weapons to the parade route. If you see something, say something to @NOPDNews.

column5: Debris crews continue the clean-up on Grant Street in #NOLA East. https://t.co/JivebQrE9b
. @LouisianaDCFS : You've said New Orleans is one City, and we are one State.
. @GOHSEP: In the 15 open disasters LA has had since Katrina, this is one of  fastest turnarounds the govt. has had w/ a major declaration
Big work ahead is debris removal. I am making a plea to have everyone in this community come out in the weeks ahead to help.
In our times of trouble, it is clear there are #AngelsAmongUs. In this response & recovery, we are one team, one fight, one voice, one City.
City Council & admin. introduced ordinance to waive building permit fee for tornado survivors. Visit https://t.co/fQQfsrBvGJ for free permit
